meanings.definition: To outmaneuver an opponent by moving around their flank.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the player tried outflanking the defender to score a goal.
meanings.sent2: The army succeeded in outflanking the enemy, surprising them from the side.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outflanked the hunter, leaving him searching in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent4: Her strategic outflanking of the competition helped her win the race.
meanings.sent5: The detective outflanked the suspect, catching him off guard.

meanings.definition: The act of gaining an advantage over someone by moving to a position on their side.
meanings.sent1: The team's outflanking of their opponents secured them the victory.
meanings.sent2: The outflanking of the rival company led to increased sales for our business.
meanings.sent3: The outflanking of the bully by his classmates brought peace to the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her outflanking of the interview panel impressed them and landed her the job.
meanings.sent5: The outflanking of the market by the new product boosted the company's profits.
